memberdef.argsstring: (const riscv_biquad_casd_df1_inst_q15 *S, const q15_t *pSrc, q15_t *pDst, uint32_t blockSize)
memberdef.name: riscv_biquad_cascade_df1_q15

briefdescription.para: Processing function for the Q15 Biquad cascade filter.

parameterdescription.para: points to an instance of the Q15 Biquad cascade structure
points to the block of input data
points to the location where the output result is written

simplesect.title: Scaling and Overflow Behavior
simplesect.para: The function is implemented using a 64-bit internal accumulator. Both coefficients and state variables are represented in 1.15 format and multiplications yield a 2.30 result. The 2.30 intermediate results are accumulated in a 64-bit accumulator in 34.30 format. There is no risk of internal overflow with this approach and the full precision of intermediate multiplications is preserved. The accumulator is then shifted by postShift bits to truncate the result to 1.15 format by discarding the low 16 bits. Finally, the result is saturated to 1.15 format.
Refer to riscv_biquad_cascade_df1_fast_q15() for a faster but less precise implementation of this filter.
